content:
AnimationTimeline Class

In this Article

Defines a segment of time over which output values are produced. These values are used to animate a target property.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class AnimationTimeline : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Freezable
  • Animatable
  • System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline
  • AnimationTimeline

Remarks

An AnimationTimeline is a type of Timeline object that generates output values based on its timing progress. All animation types inherit from AnimationTimeline.

Freezable Features: Because it inherits from the Freezable class, the AnimationTimeline class provides several special features: AnimationTimeline objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by Freezable objects, see the Freezable Objects Overview.

Constructors summary

AnimationTimeline()

Initializes a new instance of the AnimationTimeline class.

Fields summary

IsAdditiveProperty

Identifies the IsAdditive dependency property.
IsCumulativeProperty

Identifies the IsCumulative dependency property.

Properties summary

IsDestinationDefault

Gets a value that indicates whether this animation uses the defaultDestinationValue parameter of the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline.GetCurrentValue* method as its destination value.
TargetPropertyType

When overridden in a derived class, gets the Type of property that can be animated.

Methods summary

AllocateClock()

Creates a Clock for this AnimationTimeline.
Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this AnimationTimeline, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
CreateClock()

Creates a new AnimationClock from this AnimationTimeline.
GetCurrentValue(Object,Object,AnimationClock)

Gets the current value of the animation.
GetNaturalDurationCore(Clock)

Returns the length of a single iteration of this AnimationTimeline.

Constructors

  • AnimationTimeline()

    Initializes a new instance of the AnimationTimeline class.

    protected AnimationTimeline ();

Fields

  • IsAdditiveProperty

    Identifies the IsAdditive dependency property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty IsAdditiveProperty;
  • IsCumulativeProperty

    Identifies the IsCumulative dependency property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty IsCumulativeProperty;

Properties

  • IsDestinationDefault

    Gets a value that indicates whether this animation uses the defaultDestinationValue parameter of the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline.GetCurrentValue* method as its destination value.

    public virtual bool IsDestinationDefault { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the defaultDesintationValue parameter of the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline.GetCurrentValue* method is the value of this animation when reaches the end of its simple duration (its clock has a stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress* of 1); otherwise, false. The default implementation always returns false.

  • TargetPropertyType

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the Type of property that can be animated.

    public abstract Type TargetPropertyType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The type of property that can be animated by this animation.

Methods

  • AllocateClock()

    Creates a Clock for this AnimationTimeline.

    protected override System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock AllocateClock ();

    Returns

    • Clock

      A clock for this AnimationTimeline.

    Remarks

    This method is called by the CreateClock method and should not be called directly by your code.

  • Clone()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this AnimationTimeline, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

    public System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline Clone ();

    Returns

    • AnimationTimeline

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.

    For more information, see Clone.

  • CreateClock()

    Creates a new AnimationClock from this AnimationTimeline.

    public System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock CreateClock ();

    Returns

    • AnimationClock

      A new clock, created from this AnimationTimeline.

    Remarks

    This method shadows the inherited CreateClock method with a type-safe implementation.

  • GetCurrentValue(Object,Object,AnimationClock)

    Gets the current value of the animation.

    public virtual object GetCurrentValue (object defaultOriginValue, object defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);

    Parameters

    • defaultOriginValue
      Object

      The origin value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own start value. If this animation is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain.

    • defaultDestinationValue
      Object

      The destination value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own destination value.

    • animationClock
      AnimationClock

      The AnimationClock which can generate the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime* or stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress* value to be used by the animation to generate its output value.

    Returns

    • Object

      The value this animation believes should be the current value for the property.

  • GetNaturalDurationCore(Clock)

    Returns the length of a single iteration of this AnimationTimeline.

    protected override System.Windows.Duration GetNaturalDurationCore (System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock clock);

    Parameters

    • clock
      Clock

      The clock that was created for this AnimationTimeline.

    Returns

    • Duration

      The animation's natural duration. This method always returns a Duration of 1 second.

    Remarks

    This method provides the implementation for GetNaturalDuration and should not be called directly from your code.
